pr_title: KEYCLOAK-12754 Honor nested composite roles when creating roles via REST API

timeline.body:
I wonder if there should be some validation that all the composite roles actually exist. Would it make sense to fail the operation if a role was not found, not just ignore it? (This applies for client roles below as well.) We do that for the composite endpoint:
https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/blob/6f2ca347e164ecd141eac633ac4577b5768c9d01/services/src/main/java/org/keycloak/services/resources/admin/RoleContainerResource.java#L286-L288
On the other hand, we lack validation on most endpoints in general, so...

I wonder if there should be some validation that all the composite roles actually exist. Would it make sense to fail the operation if a role was not found, not just ignore it? (This applies for client roles below as well.) We do that for the composite endpoint:

keycloak/services/src/main/java/org/keycloak/services/resources/admin/RoleContainerResource.java

Lines 286 to 288 in 6f2ca34

if (role == null) {
throw new NotFoundException("Could not find role");
}

On the other hand, we lack validation on most endpoints in general, so...
timeline.author: vmuzikar

replies.bodyText: @vmuzikar sorry for the long delay,.. I just rebased the PR and added the requested checks, to ensure that the roles contained in the composite role exist. The code now throws a NotFoundException if a nested role does not exist.
replies.author: thomasdarimont
